awd_titl_txt: Novel Synthesis of New Natural Products via Genetic         Engineering
awd_abstract_narration: Polyketides are a large family of                                               natural products found in bacteria,                                             fungi, and plants.  Many of them                                                are used as antibiotics, anticancer                                             agents, immunosuppressants, and                                                 veterinary products.  They are also                                             important as natural food and                                                   flavoring agents, or as fungal                                                  toxins.  Biosynthesis of the carbon                                             backbones of all polyketides occurs                                             via a highly programmed                                                         polymerization process, which                                                   incorporates critical variations on                                             a common theme of enzyme catalyzed                                              reactions.  In each case, the                                                   highly selective sequence of                                                    reactions is catalyzed by a complex                                             enzyme known as the polyketide                                                  synthase.  The aim of this project                                              is to investigate the relationships                                             that exist between the structure                                                and the function of polyketide                                                  synthases.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
